timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't it be more efficient to accumulate all of the changes on a single MutableBeaconState and commit the changes once?  Wondering if these methods that mutate state should all just accept a MutableBeaconState?
timeline.author: mbaxter

replies.bodyText:
I was tending to make BeaconState mutations scopes as restricted as possible. Also please note that copy/update BeaconState object is now very lightweight.
Note that even if you are doing this loop with a single MutableBeaconState you would still need to calculate state hash_tree_root for every slot which implies backing tree update which is almost the same as updated() call.
I just tried to update this piece of code and make just one BeaconState.updated() per loop iteration but found another issue:
reportExceptions(CompletableFuture.runAsync(() -> recordMetrics(state)));
I.e. state is asynchronously sent to the outer world. And this should definitely be immutable BeaconState instance.
So I would leave this part as is (safer variant) until it becomes a real perf bottleneck
